result.execSummary:
The defendant David M Blanchard was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property >$10,000 [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Dated 5/08/17 from DOC to Judge Anderson.  JOC will be corrected per direction of Judge Anderson

Defendant David M Blanchard in court with attorney Erika Amundson.  Defendant David M Blanchard in custody.  James D Babbitt appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Heard along with 15CF127, 15CM150, 15CM151, 16CF68.   State recites agreement into the court record.  

12CF126- 6 years, 3 in/3 out

15CF127-6 years, 3 in/3 out

15CM150-9 months jail

15CM151-9 months jail

Credit for 637 days on all cases, except 16CF68.  CM cases concurrent and concurrent to CF cases, sentences concurrent in CF cases.  Civil JU for unpaid court obligations.  DE will be eligible for SAP, not eligible for CIP.

16CF68-Dismiss repeater, PTAC will remain.  4 years total, 2 in/2 out, consecutive to 12CF126, 15CF127.  $350.00 restitution, CC, DNA sample.  No credit for time served.  No voting until civil rights are restored, no firearms.   Ct 2 will be DRI.  DE will enter a plea of G, court accepts and finds the DE guilty.  DE will be eligible for SAP programming.  Atty Bahnson states the $350.00 has previously been forfeited, if so DE will receive credit for this.  Atty would like the court to find DE eligible for ERP program also.  DE makes a statement to the court, states he is ready to move forward and wishes to enter a treatment facilty when sentence is served.  Court will adopt the recommendations.  

Atty would like to address the issue of bond money that is being held in a GF case.  Requesting bond money be turned over to Atty Bahnson.  Court will order as such.
DE has indicated undecided at this time about seeking PCR
Sentencing hearing on revocation on January 23, 2017 at 03:00 pm.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on November 28, 2016 at 01:00 pm.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on October 11, 2016 at 03:30 pm.
